age.title: Age Calculator
age.description: Calculate your exact age in years, months, and days, and see how many days are left until your next birthday.
age.howItWorks: The age calculator works by computing the precise difference between your birth date and the current date. It analyzes complete years first, then remaining months, and finally days. The tool accounts for leap years and varying month lengths to ensure accurate results.
useCases: Calculate exact age for official documents and job applications
Find out when your next birthday is and plan celebrations
Track children's age in days and months for medical follow-ups
Determine age eligibility for various programs and services
Calculate age difference between people
seoTips: Enter your birth date accurately for correct results
Use the calculator to know your age in different units (days, hours)
Save the result for future reference when needed
commonMistakes: Entering incorrect birth date or wrong format
Confusing Gregorian and other calendar systems
Forgetting that age changes daily, not just yearly

faqs.question: How is age calculated in years, months, and days?
faqs.answer: Age is calculated by finding the difference between your birth date and today's date. First, we count complete years, then remaining months, and finally remaining days. For example, if born on March 15, 2000, and today is January 10, 2024, you would be 23 years, 9 months, and 26 days old.

faqs.question: How are leap years handled in age calculation?
faqs.answer: Our calculator accounts for leap years (years divisible by 4, except century years not divisible by 400). February 29th birthdays are calculated correctly, and the extra day in leap years is included in the total day count.

faqs.question: What is the difference between chronological age and biological age?
faqs.answer: Chronological age is your exact age based on your birth date. Biological age reflects how well your body functions compared to average people of your chronological age. This calculator determines chronological age; biological age requires medical assessments.

faqs.question: Can I calculate the age of a deceased person?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can use the calculator to find out what age a deceased person would have been if still alive by entering their birth date.

faqs.question: Why is my lunar age different from my solar age?
faqs.answer: The lunar year (Hijri) is about 11 days shorter than the solar year (Gregorian), so your lunar age will be higher than your Gregorian age.

age.error_future: Birth date cannot be in the future

date-difference.title: Date Difference Calculator
date-difference.description: Calculate the exact time duration between two different dates, including business days.
date-difference.howItWorks: This tool calculates the time difference between two dates by subtracting the first date from the second. It displays results in years, months, and days, along with total days and business days (excluding weekends).
useCases: Calculate employment duration for retirement or severance
Find out time remaining until an important event or deadline
Calculate pregnancy and due dates
Determine contract and agreement durations
Calculate vacation and absence days
seoTips: Make sure to enter the earlier date in the start field
Enable the include end date option if you want it counted
Use business days result for professional calculations
commonMistakes: Reversing the date order (putting end before start)
Forgetting that business days exclude Saturday and Sunday only
Not accounting for varying month lengths

faqs.question: How are business days calculated?
faqs.answer: Business days are calculated by subtracting weekend days (Saturday and Sunday) from total days. The calculations do not include public holidays as they vary by country.

faqs.question: Can I calculate the difference between past dates?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can calculate the difference between any two dates whether in the past or future, as long as you enter the earlier date in the start field.

faqs.question: Why does the result differ from my manual calculation?
faqs.answer: The calculator accounts for varying month lengths (28-31 days) and leap years, which may give different results than approximate manual calculations.

date-difference.start_date_tooltip: Enter the starting date of the period
date-difference.end_date_tooltip: Enter the ending date of the period
date-difference.note_text: Business days exclude weekends. Calculation accounts for varying month lengths and leap years.
date-difference.use_case_1: Calculate project duration and working days
date-difference.use_case_2: Determine time elapsed between important events
date-difference.use_case_3: Calculate age of service or employment duration
date-difference.error_start_after_end: Start date must be before end date

timezone-converter.title: Time Zone Converter
timezone-converter.description: Easily convert time between different time zones around the world.
timezone-converter.howItWorks: The converter transforms time from one timezone to another using UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) offsets. It accounts for daylight saving time when applicable in certain regions.
useCases: Schedule work meetings with teams in different countries
Find the right time to call family and friends abroad
Coordinate travel schedules and international flights
Watch live sports events and global broadcasts
Trade in global financial markets
seoTips: Select source and target timezones accurately
Watch for daylight saving time which changes the time difference
Save frequent conversions for quick reference
commonMistakes: Forgetting daylight saving time which adds or subtracts an hour
Confusing AM and PM in 12-hour format
Not accounting for date changes during conversion

faqs.question: What is UTC (Coordinated Universal Time)?
faqs.answer: UTC is the global time standard against which all time zones are measured. It was formerly known as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

faqs.question: How do I find the time difference between two countries?
faqs.answer: Enter the same time in the calculator and convert between both zones. The time difference will be apparent from the result.

faqs.question: Does the time difference change throughout the year?
faqs.answer: Yes, some countries observe daylight saving time which changes the time difference with other countries by one hour.

date-format-converter.title: Date Format Converter
date-format-converter.description: Convert dates between various global and local formats.
date-format-converter.howItWorks: The converter takes the input date and reformats it in various ways such as ISO 8601, US format, European format, Unix timestamp, and more, making it easy to use dates in different contexts.
useCases: Convert dates for use in programming and databases
Standardize date formats in official documents
Convert dates between US and European formats
Get Unix timestamps for technical applications
Format dates for reports and presentations
seoTips: Use ISO 8601 format for international compatibility
Understand the difference between DD/MM and MM/DD
Use Unix timestamps for precision in programming
commonMistakes: Confusing US format (month/day) with European format (day/month)
Forgetting that Unix timestamp starts from January 1, 1970
Not accounting for timezone in conversions

faqs.question: What is ISO 8601 format?
faqs.answer: It is the international standard for writing dates as YYYY-MM-DD (year-month-day), and is the recommended format for international and programming use.

faqs.question: What is the difference between US and European formats?
faqs.answer: US format writes the month first (MM/DD/YYYY), while European writes the day first (DD/MM/YYYY). For example: 03/05/2024 means March 5 in the US and May 3 in Europe.

faqs.question: What is a Unix timestamp?
faqs.answer: It is the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 at 00:00:00 UTC. It is widely used in programming for storing dates.

unix-timestamp-converter.title: Unix Timestamp Converter
unix-timestamp-converter.description: Convert between Unix timestamps and human-readable dates.
unix-timestamp-converter.howItWorks: This converter transforms between Unix timestamps (seconds since January 1, 1970) and human-readable dates. You can convert in both directions: from timestamp to date or vice versa.
useCases: Convert database timestamps to readable dates
Generate timestamps for use in programming
Analyze server and system logs
Debug applications that use Unix timestamps
Convert dates for API calls
seoTips: Remember that timestamps are in seconds, not milliseconds
Use the current timestamp as a reference for verification
Pay attention to timezone when converting
commonMistakes: Confusing timestamps in seconds with milliseconds
Forgetting that timestamps are based on UTC
Entering negative timestamps without knowing they represent dates before 1970

faqs.question: Why does the timestamp start from 1970?
faqs.answer: Unix developers chose this date (January 1, 1970) as the starting point because it was close to the system's development time and easy to calculate.

faqs.question: What is the difference between seconds and milliseconds?
faqs.answer: Timestamps in seconds typically have 10 digits, while milliseconds have 13 digits. Milliseconds = seconds x 1000.

faqs.question: Can dates before 1970 be represented?
faqs.answer: Yes, using negative numbers. For example: -86400 represents December 31, 1969.

day-of-week-calculator.title: Day of Week Calculator
day-of-week-calculator.description: Find out what day of the week any date falls on in the past or future.
day-of-week-calculator.howItWorks: The calculator uses mathematical algorithms to determine the day of the week for any date. It accounts for leap years and Gregorian calendar rules to provide accurate results.
useCases: Find out what day your birthday or any historical event fell on
Plan events on specific dates
Check the day of the week for a future appointment
Historical research to find days of past events
Schedule meetings and appointments
seoTips: Enter the date in the correct format for accurate results
Use the calculator to verify dates of holidays and occasions
Check the week number for planning purposes
commonMistakes: Entering dates in the wrong format
Confusing Gregorian with other calendar systems
Forgetting that weeks may start on Sunday or Monday depending on culture

faqs.question: How does the calculator determine the day of the week?
faqs.answer: The calculator uses Zeller's algorithm or similar methods to mathematically compute the day of the week based on the day, month, and year.

faqs.question: Can I find the day for very old dates?
faqs.answer: Yes, but note that the current Gregorian calendar started in 1582, and dates before that followed the Julian calendar.

faqs.question: What is the week number of the year?
faqs.answer: It is the ordinal number of the week in the year from 1 to 52 or 53, commonly used in business and planning.

yazidi-calendar.title: Yazidi Calendar Converter
yazidi-calendar.description: Convert dates between Gregorian and Yazidi calendar systems instantly.
yazidi-calendar.howItWorks: The converter transforms dates between the Gregorian calendar and the traditional Yazidi calendar, accounting for differences in year and month calculations.
useCases: Convert dates for Yazidi occasions
Find the Yazidi date equivalent of any Gregorian date
Plan religious holidays and events
Research Yazidi history and heritage
Documentation and archiving in Yazidi calendar
seoTips: Enter the date accurately for correct conversion
Learn about the Yazidi New Year for better understanding
Use the converter for event planning
commonMistakes: Confusing the Yazidi calendar with other calendars
Not understanding that the Yazidi calendar uses special calculations
Expecting exact matches with other calendars

faqs.question: What is the Yazidi calendar?
faqs.answer: It is the traditional calendar of the Yazidi religion, based on astronomical calculations and ancient traditions specific to the Yazidi community.

faqs.question: When does the Yazidi year begin?
faqs.answer: The Yazidi New Year begins on the first Wednesday after April 13 according to the Julian calendar, known as Sere Sal or Red Wednesday.

faqs.question: Is the Yazidi calendar solar or lunar?
faqs.answer: The Yazidi calendar combines solar elements with local traditions, differing from purely solar or lunar calendars.

yazidi-calendar.empty_state: Enter a date to convert between Yazidi and Gregorian calendars
yazidi-calendar.footer_note: The Yazidi calendar is based on ancient traditions. Dates are approximate.
yazidi-calendar.info_epoch: Yazidi calendar counts from approximately 4750 BCE
yazidi-calendar.info_months: The Yazidi calendar has 13 months (12 months of 30 days + 1 short month)
yazidi-calendar.info_new_year: Yazidi New Year falls on the first Wednesday after April 13 (Julian)
yazidi-calendar.error_year_range: Gregorian year must be between 1 and 9999

fixed-christian-feasts.title: Fixed Christian Feasts Calculator
fixed-christian-feasts.description: Find dates for fixed holidays like Christmas, Epiphany, and Annunciation for any year.
fixed-christian-feasts.howItWorks: The calculator displays dates for Christian feasts that fall on the same date each year. It includes feasts for both Western (Gregorian) and Eastern (Julian) traditions with the 13-day difference.
useCases: Find Christian feast dates for a specific year
Plan religious and family celebrations
Compare feast dates between Western and Eastern churches
Plan holidays and travel during religious seasons
Learn about Christian religious occasions
seoTips: Understand the difference between Gregorian and Julian calendars
Use the calculator for advance planning
Compare dates between Western and Eastern traditions
commonMistakes: Confusing fixed and movable feasts
Forgetting the 13-day difference between Julian and Gregorian calendars
Assuming all churches celebrate on the same date

faqs.question: What is the difference between fixed and movable feasts?
faqs.answer: Fixed feasts fall on the same date each year (like Christmas on December 25), while movable feasts change according to Easter calculations.

faqs.question: Why is Orthodox Christmas different?
faqs.answer: Eastern Orthodox churches use the Julian calendar which is 13 days behind the Gregorian, so December 25 Julian falls on January 7 Gregorian.

faqs.question: Do all churches celebrate the same feasts?
faqs.answer: Most major feasts are shared, but some are specific to certain denominations like the Immaculate Conception in the Catholic Church.

movable-christian-holy-days.title: Movable Christian Holy Days Calculator
movable-christian-holy-days.description: Calculate movable Christian dates like Ash Wednesday, Pentecost, and Ascension.
movable-christian-holy-days.howItWorks: The tool calculates the Easter date using the Computus algorithm, then determines dates for other movable feasts based on the number of days before or after Easter.
useCases: Find the Easter date for any year
Plan for the Lenten season
Find dates for Ash Wednesday, Pentecost, and Ascension
Compare Western and Eastern Easter dates
Plan church activities throughout the year
seoTips: Learn about the Easter calculation algorithm
Note that Eastern and Western Easter sometimes coincide
Use the calculator for long-term planning
commonMistakes: Confusing Western and Eastern Easter dates
Forgetting that Lent begins 40 days before Easter
Not accounting for differences between denominations

faqs.question: How is Easter date calculated?
faqs.answer: Easter falls on the first Sunday after the first full moon following the spring equinox (March 21). Western churches use the Gregorian calendar, Eastern use the Julian.

faqs.question: Why do Western and Eastern Easter differ?
faqs.answer: Due to using different calendars (Gregorian and Julian) and slightly different calculation methods, the difference can range from one to five weeks.

faqs.question: What is the Computus algorithm?
faqs.answer: It is an ancient calculation method developed to determine Easter date without direct astronomical observation, based on lunar and solar cycles.

coptic-holy-days.title: Coptic Holy Days Calculator
coptic-holy-days.description: Find dates for fixed and movable Coptic Orthodox feasts and religious occasions.
coptic-holy-days.howItWorks: The tool calculates Coptic holy day dates based on the Coptic calendar (Era of Martyrs). It displays both fixed feasts and movable ones linked to Coptic Easter, with conversion to Gregorian dates.
useCases: Find Coptic feast dates for a specific year
Plan Coptic church events
Know fasting and feast schedules
Convert Coptic dates to Gregorian
Learn about the Coptic liturgical calendar
seoTips: Enter the Coptic year (Era of Martyrs) for results
Note that the Coptic year begins in September
Understand the difference between fixed and movable feasts
commonMistakes: Confusing Coptic and Gregorian years
Forgetting that Coptic Easter follows Julian calculation
Not accounting for the Coptic year starting in September

faqs.question: What is the Era of Martyrs?
faqs.answer: It is the starting point of the Coptic calendar from 284 CE, the year Emperor Diocletian began his severe persecution of Christians.

faqs.question: How do I convert Gregorian to Coptic year?
faqs.answer: Subtract 283 or 284 from the Gregorian year depending on the month. For example: 2024 CE = 1740 or 1741 Coptic.

faqs.question: Why does Coptic Easter differ from Western Easter?
faqs.answer: The Coptic Church uses the Julian calendar for Easter calculation, which usually makes it later than Western Easter.

hebrew-holidays.title: Hebrew Holidays Calendar
hebrew-holidays.description: Find dates for Hebrew feasts and fasts including Rosh Hashanah, Yom Kippur, and Passover.
hebrew-holidays.howItWorks: The tool calculates Hebrew holiday and fast dates based on the Hebrew lunisolar calendar. It displays dates in both Hebrew and Gregorian calendars with holiday classification by importance.

Plan religious and family events
Know fast days in the Hebrew calendar
Coordinate with Jewish colleagues and friends
Learn about Jewish traditions and culture
seoTips: Enter the Hebrew year (e.g., 5784) for results
Remember that holidays begin at sunset
Understand the difference between major and minor holidays
commonMistakes: Forgetting that the Jewish day begins at sunset
Confusing Hebrew and Gregorian years
Not accounting for additional days observed outside Israel

faqs.question: How does the Hebrew calendar work?
faqs.answer: It is a lunisolar calendar with 12 or 13 months. Adar II is added 7 times every 19 years to align with the solar year.

faqs.question: Why do holidays begin at sunset?
faqs.answer: Because the Jewish day begins at sunset and ends at the following sunset, based on Genesis: 'And there was evening and there was morning.'

faqs.question: What is the difference between Israel and Diaspora observance?
faqs.answer: Some holidays like Passover and Sukkot are observed for an additional day outside Israel (Diaspora) due to historical calendar uncertainty.

holy-week-dates.title: Holy Week Dates Calculator
holy-week-dates.description: Find exact dates for Palm Sunday, Maundy Thursday, Good Friday, and Easter for any year.
holy-week-dates.howItWorks: The tool first calculates Easter date using the Computus algorithm, then determines Holy Week dates (from Lazarus Saturday through Easter Monday) for both Western and Eastern traditions.
useCases: Find Holy Week dates for any year
Plan participation in prayers and services
Compare Holy Week dates between churches
Plan travel and holidays during Easter season
Coordinate with family and friends for celebrations
seoTips: Enter the year to get dates for both traditions
Compare Western and Eastern dates
Plan Holy Week activities in advance
commonMistakes: Assuming Western and Eastern Easter fall on the same date
Forgetting that Holy Week begins with Lazarus Saturday
Confusing Gregorian and Julian calendars

faqs.question: What is Holy Week?
faqs.answer: It is the final week of Lent preceding Easter, commemorating Christ's passion, crucifixion, death, and resurrection.

faqs.question: Why does Easter date change each year?
faqs.answer: Because Easter depends on the lunar cycle, falling on the first Sunday after the first full moon following the spring equinox.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Good Friday and Holy Saturday?
faqs.answer: Good Friday commemorates Christ's crucifixion, while Holy Saturday is the day of mourning and waiting before the joy of resurrection.

samaritan-calendar-converter.title: Samaritan Calendar Converter
samaritan-calendar-converter.description: Convert dates between Gregorian and Samaritan calendar systems online easily.
samaritan-calendar-converter.howItWorks: The converter transforms dates between the Gregorian and Samaritan calendars. The Samaritan calendar is similar to the Hebrew calendar but counts from the entry into Canaan.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Samaritan and Hebrew calendars?
faqs.answer: The Samaritan calendar is similar to Hebrew in structure but counts from the entry into Canaan (about 3636 BCE) rather than creation, and relies on direct astronomical observation.

faqs.question: Who are the Samaritans?
faqs.answer: The Samaritans are an ancient religious community living in Nablus and Holon, who consider themselves keepers of the original Torah and hold Mount Gerizim as sacred.

faqs.question: Why are the dates approximate?
faqs.answer: Because the Samaritan calendar relies on actual observation of the new moon and spring equinox, which may cause slight variations.

samaritan-festivals.title: Samaritan Festivals Calculator
samaritan-festivals.description: Find dates for religious holidays including Passover, Shavuot, and Sukkot.
samaritan-festivals.howItWorks: The tool calculates dates for the seven biblical Samaritan festivals based on the Samaritan calendar and converts them to Gregorian dates. Dates are approximate as they depend on astronomical observation.
useCases: Find Samaritan festival dates for a specific year
Plan visits to Mount Gerizim during festivals
Witness the Samaritan Passover sacrifice
Academic research on Samaritan traditions
Learn about Samaritan religion and festivals
seoTips: Enter the Gregorian year to get festival dates
Remember that dates are approximate
Learn about the three annual pilgrimages
commonMistakes: Expecting exact match with Jewish holidays
Forgetting that Samaritan Passover sacrifice is still performed
Not understanding that festivals are celebrated on Mount Gerizim

faqs.question: What are the major Samaritan festivals?
faqs.answer: The seven biblical festivals: Passover, Unleavened Bread, Shavuot (Weeks), Yom Teru'ah, Yom Kippur, Sukkot (Tabernacles), and Shemini Atzeret.

faqs.question: What is the Samaritan Passover sacrifice?
faqs.answer: It is an annual ritual performed by Samaritans on Mount Gerizim, where they sacrifice lambs at sunset as prescribed in the Torah, one of the last remaining sacrificial traditions.

faqs.question: Where do Samaritans celebrate their festivals?
faqs.answer: Samaritans celebrate their festivals on Mount Gerizim near Nablus, which they consider the holiest place on earth.

yazidi-new-year.title: Yazidi New Year Calculator
yazidi-new-year.description: Find the date of Charshema Sor (Red Wednesday) and upcoming celebrations.
yazidi-new-year.howItWorks: The tool calculates the date of Sere Sal (Yazidi New Year) which falls on the first Wednesday after April 13 according to the Julian calendar, approximately April 14-20 in the Gregorian calendar.
useCases: Find Sere Sal date for any year
Plan Yazidi New Year celebrations
Know upcoming celebration dates
Learn about Yazidi calendar and culture
Coordinate with Yazidi friends for occasions
seoTips: Enter the Gregorian year to get the date
Learn about the meaning of Red Wednesday
Use the calculator for advance planning
commonMistakes: Confusing Gregorian and Julian calendars
Assuming Sere Sal falls on the same date each year
Not understanding that the date is tied to Wednesday

faqs.question: What does Sere Sal mean?
faqs.answer: Sere Sal means 'Head of the Year' in Kurdish, also known as Charshema Sor or Red Wednesday, and is the most important holiday in the Yazidi religion.

faqs.question: Why is it called Red Wednesday?
faqs.answer: The color red is associated with spring, renewal, and life. Yazidis decorate their homes with red flowers and colored eggs to celebrate this day.

faqs.question: How is Sere Sal celebrated?
faqs.answer: It is celebrated by visiting holy sites especially Lalish, coloring eggs, preparing traditional foods, lighting lamps, and wearing new clothes.

coptic_calendar_info.title: Coptic Calendar Months
coptic_calendar_info.description: Learn the 13 Coptic months and how they map to Gregorian dates.
coptic_calendar_info.howItWorks: This guide displays the 13 Coptic months with their corresponding Gregorian date ranges. The Coptic calendar is based on the ancient Egyptian calendar with Julian modifications.
useCases: Understand the Coptic calendar structure
Know Coptic month dates in Gregorian calendar
Learn Coptic month names
Understand the Coptic leap year system
Comparative calendar studies
seoTips: Learn all 13 Coptic months
Note that month 13 is short (5-6 days)
Remember the Coptic year begins in September
commonMistakes: Forgetting the 13th month (Nasie/Epagomenal)
Confusing Coptic and Gregorian year starts
Not accounting for leap years

faqs.question: How many months are in the Coptic calendar?
faqs.answer: The Coptic calendar has 13 months: 12 months of 30 days each, and a small month (Nasie) of 5 days or 6 in leap years.

faqs.question: When does the Coptic year begin?
faqs.answer: The Coptic year begins on 1 Thout, which usually corresponds to September 11 (or September 12 before a Gregorian leap year).

faqs.question: What is the origin of Coptic month names?
faqs.answer: Month names derive from ancient Egyptian gods and festivals, such as Thout (god of wisdom) and Hathor (goddess of love).

coptic_calendar_info.overview_point: The Coptic year has 13 months: 12 months of 30 days plus a small epagomenal month of 5 or 6 days in leap years.
coptic_calendar_info.leap_note: A leap day is added every four years without exception, so the Coptic New Year usually falls on 11 September (or 12 September before a Gregorian leap year).
coptic_calendar_info.accuracy_desc: The Coptic calendar uses a fixed solar year similar to the Julian calendar; long-term drift versus the Gregorian calendar is about 1 day every 3322 years.

hebrew_calendar_info.title: Hebrew Calendar Months
hebrew_calendar_info.description: Learn the 13 Hebrew months and how the lunisolar calendar works.
hebrew_calendar_info.howItWorks: This guide explains the Hebrew lunisolar calendar structure with 12 or 13 months. An extra month (Adar II) is added in leap years to maintain synchronization with seasons.
useCases: Understand the Hebrew calendar structure
Learn Hebrew month names
Understand the Hebrew leap year system
Learn about varying month lengths
Comparative calendar studies
seoTips: Learn about the 19-year cycle
Understand the difference between regular and leap years
Learn month names in Hebrew and English
commonMistakes: Confusing Adar and Adar II
Forgetting that Hebrew months are lunar (29-30 days)
Assuming all years have the same number of months

faqs.question: Why is an extra month added?
faqs.answer: Because the lunar year is about 11 days shorter than solar. Adar II is added 7 times every 19 years to keep holidays in their proper seasons.

faqs.question: What is the Metonic cycle?
faqs.answer: It is a 19-year cycle where the leap year pattern repeats: years 3, 6, 8, 11, 14, 17, and 19 of each cycle are leap years.

faqs.question: Why do some months have different lengths?
faqs.answer: Cheshvan and Kislev may be 29 or 30 days depending on year type (deficient, regular, or complete) to adjust the year length.

hebrew_calendar_info.overview_point: The Hebrew calendar is a lunisolar calendar with 12 or 13 months. A 13th month (Adar II) is added 7 times every 19 years to keep it synchronized with the solar year.
hebrew_calendar_info.leap_note: * Added in leap years (7 times every 19 years)
hebrew_calendar_info.leap_years_desc: The Hebrew calendar adds a 30-day month (Adar II) in leap years to align with the solar year. This follows a 19-year Metonic cycle.
hebrew_calendar_info.year_month_day_desc: Hebrew dates are written as: Year (e.g., 5784), Month (Hebrew name), Day (1-30).
hebrew_calendar_info.religious_desc: The Hebrew calendar determines dates for Jewish holidays, fasts, and Torah readings. It is used for religious observances worldwide.

Early planning for the celebration

faqs.question: What is Bar/Bat Mitzvah?
faqs.answer: It is a Jewish religious event marking the coming of age. Bar Mitzvah is for males at 13, Bat Mitzvah is for females at 12.

faqs.question: Why is the age different for males and females?
faqs.answer: According to Jewish tradition, girls reach spiritual maturity a year earlier than boys, so they celebrate a year earlier.

faqs.question: When is the ceremony held?
faqs.answer: The ceremony is usually held on the first Shabbat (Saturday) after the Hebrew birthday, when the young person reads from the Torah for the first time.

bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.celebration_info_description: Bar Mitzvah (for boys) and Bat Mitzvah (for girls) are important Jewish lifecycle events marking the coming of age at 13 and 12 respectively. These ceremonies signify that a young person is now responsible for following Jewish law and tradition.
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.celebration_saturday: The ceremony typically takes place on the first Shabbat (Saturday) after the birthday
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.celebration_traditions: Traditional customs include reading from the Torah and leading parts of the prayer service
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.tradition_2: Leading parts of the prayer service
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.planning_description: Start planning 6-12 months in advance. Consider venue, invitations, catering, and religious requirements. Consult with your synagogue for specific guidelines.
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.error_invalid_date: Please enter a valid birth date
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.error_calculation: Error calculating date. Please try again.
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.empty_state: Enter your birth date to calculate Bar/Bat Mitzvah date
bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.footer_note: Calculations use simplified Hebrew calendar conversion. Consult with a rabbi for exact dates.

Understand differences between Eastern and Western traditions
Learn the connection between Holy Week days
commonMistakes: Confusing Eastern and Western Holy Week
Forgetting that Holy Week begins with Lazarus Saturday
Not understanding the significance of each day

faqs.question: Why is it called Holy Week?
faqs.answer: Because it commemorates Christ's passion in his final days: betrayal, trial, crucifixion, and death, before the joy of resurrection.

faqs.question: What is the significance of Good Friday?
faqs.answer: It is the most sorrowful day of the year, commemorating Christ's crucifixion and death on the cross. Believers fast and participate in special prayers.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Holy Saturday and Easter Sunday?
faqs.answer: Holy Saturday is the day of waiting and mourning with Christ in the tomb, while Easter Sunday is the joy of resurrection and victory over death.

holy-week-info.overview_description: Holy Week is the week preceding Easter in the Eastern Orthodox Church, commemorating the final week of Jesus Christ's life on earth. It is the most sacred time in the Orthodox liturgical calendar.
holy-week-info.week_intro: Each day of Holy Week has special liturgical services and spiritual significance
holy-week-info.lazarus_description: Commemorates the raising of Lazarus, foreshadowing Christ's resurrection
holy-week-info.palm_description: Celebrates Christ's triumphal entry into Jerusalem
holy-week-info.monday_description: Commemorates the cursing of the fig tree and the cleansing of the Temple
holy-week-info.tuesday_description: Focuses on the parables of the ten virgins and the talents
holy-week-info.wednesday_description: Commemorates the betrayal of Christ by Judas
holy-week-info.thursday_description: Celebrates the Last Supper and the institution of the Eucharist
holy-week-info.friday_description: Commemorates the crucifixion and death of Christ
holy-week-info.saturday_description: The day Christ rested in the tomb, awaiting resurrection
holy-week-info.differences_description: As a result, Holy Week is typically celebrated on different dates between the Eastern and Western traditions, though in some years the celebrations may coincide.

coptic-to-gregorian.title: Coptic to Gregorian Date Converter
coptic-to-gregorian.description: Convert Coptic calendar dates to Gregorian calendar dates. Free online tool for date conversion.
coptic-to-gregorian.howItWorks: The converter transforms dates from the Coptic calendar (Era of Martyrs) to the Gregorian calendar using precise calculations that account for leap years in both calendars.
useCases: Convert Coptic feast dates to Gregorian
Find Gregorian dates for Coptic events
Plan church occasions
Historical and academic research
Documentation and archiving
seoTips: Enter the Coptic year (Era of Martyrs)
Remember month 13 is Nasie (5-6 days)
Check for leap year for accuracy
commonMistakes: Entering Gregorian year instead of Coptic
Forgetting month 13 exists
Confusing month lengths

faqs.question: How do I know the current Coptic year?
faqs.answer: Subtract 283 or 284 from the Gregorian year depending on the month. Before September subtract 284, after subtract 283.

faqs.question: Why is month 13 short?
faqs.answer: Month 13 (Nasie/Epagomenal) contains extra days to complete the solar year: 5 days in regular years, 6 in leap years.

faqs.question: How accurate is the conversion?
faqs.answer: The conversion is very accurate since both calendars are solar. The difference with Julian calendar is fixed.

coptic-to-gregorian.month_note: Month 13 is the small month (epagomenal days)
coptic-to-gregorian.martyrs_era: Coptic calendar counts from the Era of Martyrs (284 CE)
coptic-to-gregorian.months_structure: 12 months of 30 days + small month of 5-6 days
coptic-to-gregorian.leap_year: Leap year every 4 years (small month has 6 days)
coptic-to-gregorian.start_date: Coptic New Year is approximately August 29/30
coptic-to-gregorian.error_conversion: Error converting date. Please try again.

hebrew-to-gregorian.title: Hebrew to Gregorian Date Converter
hebrew-to-gregorian.description: Convert Hebrew calendar dates to Gregorian calendar dates. Free online tool for date conversion.
hebrew-to-gregorian.howItWorks: The converter transforms dates from the Hebrew lunisolar calendar to Gregorian, accounting for leap years (13 months) and varying month lengths.
useCases: Convert Jewish holiday dates to Gregorian
Find Yahrzeit (death anniversary) dates
Plan Bar/Bat Mitzvah

seoTips: Enter the Hebrew year (e.g., 5784)
Check if it's a leap year (has Adar II)
Watch for Adar II in leap years
commonMistakes: Confusing Adar and Adar II
Entering Gregorian year instead of Hebrew
Forgetting that month lengths vary

faqs.question: How do I know the current Hebrew year?
faqs.answer: Add 3760 or 3761 to the Gregorian year depending on the month. For example: 2024 = 5784 or 5785 Hebrew.

faqs.question: What is Adar II?
faqs.answer: It is an extra month added in leap years (7 times every 19 years) to keep the calendar synchronized with seasons.

faqs.question: Why do some months have different lengths?
faqs.answer: Cheshvan and Kislev may be 29 or 30 days to adjust year length, as there are three year types: deficient, regular, and complete.

hebrew-to-gregorian.info_notes: Hebrew calendar is lunisolar with 12 or 13 months. Leap years occur 7 times in a 19-year cycle.
hebrew-to-gregorian.error_conversion: Error converting date. Please try again.

date_difference.title: Date Difference Calculator
date_difference.description: Calculate the exact time duration between two different dates.

howItWorks.title: How the Date Difference Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Difference = End Date - Start Date (accounting for varying month lengths and leap years)
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator computes the precise time difference between any two dates. It accounts for the varying lengths of months (28-31 days), leap years, and can calculate business days by excluding weekends. The algorithm processes complete years first, then remaining months, and finally days.

steps.name: Enter Start Date
steps.text: Input the beginning date of the period you want to measure

steps.name: Enter End Date
steps.text: Input the ending date of the period

steps.name: Optional: Include End Date
steps.text: Choose whether to count the end date itself in the calculation

steps.name: View Results
steps.text: See the difference in years, months, days, plus total days and business days

useCases.title: Employment Duration Calculation
useCases.description: Calculate exact length of service for retirement benefits, severance pay, or job applications

useCases.title: Project Timeline Planning
useCases.description: Determine the number of working days available for project completion

useCases.title: Pregnancy and Due Date Tracking
useCases.description: Calculate weeks of pregnancy or days until expected delivery

useCases.title: Contract and Lease Management
useCases.description: Verify exact duration of agreements for legal and financial purposes

useCases.title: Event Countdown
useCases.description: Find out exactly how many days until an important event or deadline

seoTips: Always enter the earlier date in the start field for positive results
Enable 'Include end date' when both dates should be counted (e.g., for hotel stays)
Business days calculation excludes Saturdays and Sundays only, not public holidays
Use total days for simple duration; use years/months/days for human-readable format
For legal documents, verify whether the end date should be inclusive or exclusive
commonMistakes: Entering the end date before the start date, which produces negative or error results
Forgetting that business days exclude weekends but not public holidays
Not considering that months have different lengths (28-31 days)
Assuming February always has 28 days (29 in leap years)
Confusing 'duration' with 'count' - a stay from Jan 1-3 is 2 nights but 3 days inclusive

faqs.question: How are business days calculated?
faqs.answer: Business days count only weekdays (Monday through Friday), excluding Saturdays and Sundays. Public holidays are not excluded as they vary by country and region. For accurate business day counts including holidays, you may need to adjust manually.

faqs.question: Why does my calculation differ from counting on a calendar?
faqs.answer: The calculator accounts for varying month lengths and leap years precisely. Manual counting often uses approximations (30 days per month) which can be off by several days over longer periods.

faqs.question: Should I include the end date in my calculation?
faqs.answer: It depends on your purpose. For hotel stays or event duration, include it. For calculating someone's age or time elapsed, typically exclude it. The calculator gives you both options.

faqs.question: Can I calculate the difference between dates in different years?
faqs.answer: Yes, the calculator handles any date range across different years, correctly accounting for leap years and the varying number of days in each month throughout the period.

faqs.question: What is the maximum date range I can calculate?
faqs.answer: The calculator can handle dates spanning many centuries. However, for extremely long periods, results in years/months/days are more meaningful than total days or hours.

date_difference.info_description: Calculates exact time between dates including business days.
date_difference.error_start_after_end: Start date must be before end date

holy-week-traditions.description: Discover the various traditions and customs of Holy Week across different Christian denominations.
holy-week-traditions.howItWorks: This guide explores the different traditions and rituals of Holy Week in Catholic, Orthodox, and Protestant churches, explaining historical origins and spiritual meanings.

seoTips: Compare Eastern and Western traditions

commonMistakes: Assuming all churches follow the same traditions
Confusing Eastern and Western rituals
Not understanding the historical context of traditions

faqs.question: Why do Holy Week traditions differ?
faqs.answer: Different traditions developed over centuries in various geographical and cultural regions, while maintaining the common core of commemorating Christ's passion and resurrection.

faqs.question: What are the main differences between East and West?
faqs.answer: Differences include: calendar used, fasting length, liturgical rituals, use of icons, and style of chanting and church music.

faqs.question: Can I participate in another church's rituals?
faqs.answer: Generally yes, visiting and participating in prayers is welcome in most churches, though communion may be subject to each denomination's rules.

lunar-age.title: Lunar Age Calculator
lunar-age.description: Calculate your age in the lunar Hijri calendar in years, months, and days.
lunar-age.howItWorks: This tool calculates your age in the Hijri lunar calendar. Since the lunar year is about 11 days shorter than the solar year, your lunar age will be higher than your Gregorian age.
useCases: Know your age in the Hijri calendar
Calculate your Hijri birthday anniversary
Compare lunar and solar ages
Religious and cultural purposes
Comparative calendar research
seoTips: Enter your Gregorian birth date to get lunar age
Compare your lunar and solar ages
Find out your Hijri birth date
commonMistakes: Expecting lunar age to equal solar age
Forgetting that the lunar year is shorter
Confusing Hijri and Gregorian birth dates

faqs.question: Why is my lunar age higher than my Gregorian age?
faqs.answer: Because the lunar year (approximately 354 days) is shorter than the solar year (365 days) by about 11 days, so more lunar years pass in the same period.

faqs.question: How do I calculate the difference between the two ages?
faqs.answer: Approximately, every 33 solar years equals 34 lunar years. Or multiply your solar age by 1.03 for a rough estimate.

faqs.question: What is the importance of knowing lunar age?
faqs.answer: The Hijri calendar is used for Islamic religious events, and some religious rulings depend on lunar age.

lunar-age.birth_date_tooltip: Enter your birth date in Gregorian calendar
lunar-age.info_description: This tool calculates your age based on the Islamic Hijri calendar. A lunar year is about 11 days shorter than a solar year, so your lunar age will be higher than your Gregorian age.

lunar-age.fact_2: A lunar month is based on the moon cycle (29-30 days)
lunar-age.fact_3: The Hijri calendar is used for Islamic religious events
lunar-age.error_future: Birth date cannot be in the future

fixed-feasts.howItWorks: Fixed feasts in the Christian calendar occur on the same date annually. This calculator displays these dates for any given year, helping you plan religious observances and celebrations.

faqs.question: What are fixed feasts?
faqs.answer: Fixed feasts are Christian holidays that occur on the same calendar date each year, such as Christmas on December 25th.

faqs.question: Why do some churches celebrate on different dates?
faqs.answer: Some Orthodox churches use the Julian calendar, which differs from the Gregorian calendar by 13 days.

faqs.question: Are fixed feasts the same in all denominations?
faqs.answer: Most major fixed feasts like Christmas are universal, but some saint days may vary between Catholic, Orthodox, and Protestant traditions.

movable-feasts.title: Movable Christian Feasts Calculator
movable-feasts.description: Calculate dates of movable Christian holidays including Easter, Pentecost, Ascension Day, and other celebrations that change each year based on the lunar calendar.
movable-feasts.howItWorks: Movable feasts are calculated based on the date of Easter, which is determined by the first Sunday after the first full moon following the spring equinox. This calculator computes all related dates for any year.
useCases: Determining Easter date for any year

commonMistakes: Confusing Western and Eastern Easter dates
Not understanding the lunar calculation basis
Forgetting that related feasts depend on Easter date

faqs.question: Why does Easter date change every year?
faqs.answer: Easter is calculated as the first Sunday after the first full moon following the spring equinox, making it a lunisolar holiday.

faqs.question: What's the difference between Western and Eastern Easter?
faqs.answer: Western churches use the Gregorian calendar while most Eastern Orthodox churches use the Julian calendar for Easter calculations.

faqs.question: How are other movable feasts calculated?
faqs.answer: Most movable feasts are calculated relative to Easter: Ash Wednesday is 46 days before, Ascension is 39 days after, and Pentecost is 49 days after Easter.

movable-feasts.tooltip_year: Enter the year (1583 onwards for Gregorian calendar)
movable-feasts.easter_day: Easter Sunday - The Resurrection of Christ
movable-feasts.empty_state: Enter a year to see all movable Christian holy day dates
movable-feasts.footer_note: Movable feasts are calculated based on Easter Sunday using the Computus algorithm. Western churches use the Gregorian calendar, Eastern Orthodox churches use the Julian calendar.
movable-feasts.info_computus: Easter date is calculated using the Computus algorithm
movable-feasts.info_difference: Western and Eastern Easter can differ by 1-5 weeks
movable-feasts.info_movable: All movable feasts are calculated relative to Easter Sunday

samaritan-calendar.title: Samaritan Calendar Converter
samaritan-calendar.description: Convert dates between the Gregorian calendar and the ancient Samaritan calendar system.

howItWorks.title: How the Samaritan Calendar Converter Works
howItWorks.formula: Samaritan Year = Gregorian Year + 3636 (approximately, based on the Entry into Canaan epoch)
howItWorks.explanation: The Samaritan calendar is a lunisolar calendar similar to the Hebrew calendar but with a different epoch. While the Hebrew calendar counts from Creation (Anno Mundi), the Samaritan calendar counts from the Entry into Canaan, approximately 3636 BCE. The calendar uses 12 or 13 months following the 19-year Metonic cycle to stay aligned with the solar year.

steps.name: Select Conversion Direction
steps.text: Choose whether to convert from Gregorian to Samaritan or Samaritan to Gregorian

steps.name: Enter the Date
steps.text: Input the year, month, and day in the source calendar system

steps.name: Convert
steps.text: Click convert to see the equivalent date in the target calendar

steps.name: Review Results
steps.text: View the converted date along with year type (regular or leap year)

seoTips: The Samaritan calendar is similar to Hebrew but counts from a different epoch (Entry into Canaan)
Dates may vary slightly due to actual astronomical observation practices
Leap years add a 13th month (Adar II) following the Metonic cycle
Mount Gerizim is the holy site where Samaritans celebrate all major festivals
The Samaritan community today numbers only about 800 people worldwide
commonMistakes: Confusing the Samaritan calendar with the Hebrew calendar (different epochs)
Expecting exact precision - Samaritan dates traditionally depend on actual moon observation
Forgetting that like Hebrew, Samaritan months can have 29 or 30 days
Not accounting for leap years when the calendar has 13 months instead of 12
Assuming Samaritan and Jewish holidays always fall on the same dates

faqs.question: What is the difference between Samaritan and Hebrew calendars?
faqs.answer: Both are lunisolar calendars with similar structures, but they count from different starting points. The Hebrew calendar counts from Creation (approximately 3761 BCE), while the Samaritan calendar counts from the Entry into Canaan (approximately 3636 BCE). They may also differ in determining leap years and festival dates due to different traditions of astronomical observation.

faqs.question: Who are the Samaritans?
faqs.answer: The Samaritans are an ancient ethno-religious group originating from the region of Samaria. They consider themselves the true keepers of the original Israelite religion, following the Torah and holding Mount Gerizim (not Jerusalem) as their holiest site. Today, about 800 Samaritans live in two communities: Holon, Israel and on Mount Gerizim near Nablus.

faqs.question: Why are the converted dates approximate?
faqs.answer: The traditional Samaritan calendar relies on actual astronomical observation of the new moon and spring equinox, which can vary slightly from calculated dates. This calculator uses mathematical algorithms that closely approximate but may not exactly match traditional determinations.

faqs.question: What is the Metonic cycle?
faqs.answer: The Metonic cycle is a period of 19 years after which the lunar phases recur on the same days of the solar year. Both Hebrew and Samaritan calendars use this cycle to determine when to add a 13th month (leap month), keeping the lunar calendar aligned with the seasons.

faqs.question: When is the Samaritan New Year?
faqs.answer: Unlike the Hebrew calendar where Rosh Hashanah falls in Tishrei (autumn), the Samaritan religious year begins in Nisan (spring), following the biblical prescription that Nisan is the first month. This aligns with Passover being the first major festival of the year.

faqs.question: What are the major Samaritan festivals?
faqs.answer: The seven biblical festivals: Passover, Unleavened Bread, Shavuot (Weeks), Yom Teru'ah, Yom Kippur, Sukkot (Tabernacles), and Shemini Atzeret.

faqs.question: What is the Samaritan Passover sacrifice?
faqs.answer: It is an annual ritual performed by Samaritans on Mount Gerizim, where they sacrifice lambs at sunset as prescribed in the Torah, one of the last remaining sacrificial traditions in the world.

faqs.question: Where do Samaritans celebrate their festivals?
faqs.answer: Samaritans celebrate their festivals on Mount Gerizim near Nablus, which they consider the holiest place on earth according to their tradition.

faqs.question: What is the Era of Martyrs?
faqs.answer: It is the starting point of the Coptic calendar from 284 CE, the year Emperor Diocletian began his severe persecution of Christians in Egypt.

faqs.question: How do I convert Gregorian to Coptic year?
faqs.answer: Subtract 283 or 284 from the Gregorian year depending on the month. Before September subtract 284, after September subtract 283. For example: 2024 CE = 1740 or 1741 Coptic.

faqs.question: Why does Coptic Easter differ from Western Easter?
faqs.answer: The Coptic Church uses the Julian calendar for Easter calculation, which usually makes it later than Western Easter celebrated according to the Gregorian calendar.

faqs.question: How does the Hebrew calendar work?
faqs.answer: It is a lunisolar calendar with 12 or 13 months. Adar II is added 7 times every 19 years to align the lunar calendar with the solar year and keep holidays in their proper seasons.

faqs.question: Why do holidays begin at sunset?
faqs.answer: Because the Jewish day begins at sunset and ends at the following sunset, based on the Torah: 'And there was evening and there was morning' (Genesis 1).

faqs.question: What is the difference between Israel and Diaspora observance?
faqs.answer: Some holidays like Passover and Sukkot are observed for an additional day outside Israel (Diaspora) due to historical calendar uncertainty before fixed calendar calculations existed.

holy-week-dates.title: Holy Week Dates Calculator
holy-week-dates.description: Find exact dates for Palm Sunday, Maundy Thursday, Good Friday, and Easter for any year.
holy-week-dates.howItWorks: The tool first calculates Easter date using the Computus algorithm, then determines Holy Week dates (from Lazarus Saturday through Easter Monday) for both Western (Gregorian) and Eastern (Julian) traditions.
useCases: Find Holy Week dates for any year
Plan participation in prayers and church services
Compare Holy Week dates between Western and Eastern churches
Plan travel and holidays during Easter season
Coordinate with family and friends for celebrations
seoTips: Enter the year to get dates for both traditions
Compare Western and Eastern dates side by side
Plan Holy Week activities well in advance
commonMistakes: Assuming Western and Eastern Easter fall on the same date
Forgetting that Holy Week begins with Lazarus Saturday
Confusing Gregorian and Julian calendars

faqs.question: What is Holy Week?
faqs.answer: It is the final week of Lent preceding Easter, commemorating Christ's passion, crucifixion, death, and resurrection. It is the most sacred time in the Christian calendar.

faqs.question: Why does Easter date change each year?
faqs.answer: Because Easter depends on the lunar cycle, falling on the first Sunday after the first full moon following the spring equinox (March 21).

faqs.question: What is the difference between Good Friday and Holy Saturday?
faqs.answer: Good Friday commemorates Christ's crucifixion and death, while Holy Saturday is the day of mourning and waiting with Christ in the tomb before the joy of resurrection on Easter Sunday.

holy-week-dates.empty_state: Enter a year to see Holy Week dates
holy-week-dates.footer_note: Holy Week dates are calculated using the Computus algorithm. Western churches use the Gregorian calendar, Eastern Orthodox churches use the Julian calendar.
holy-week-dates.info_computus: Easter date is calculated using the ancient Computus algorithm
holy-week-dates.info_difference: Western and Eastern Easter can differ by up to 5 weeks
holy-week-dates.info_holy_week: Holy Week is the most solemn week in the Christian calendar

yazidi-new-year.title: Yazidi New Year Calculator
yazidi-new-year.description: Find the date of Charshema Sor (Red Wednesday) and upcoming celebrations.
yazidi-new-year.howItWorks: The tool calculates the date of Sere Sal (Yazidi New Year) which falls on the first Wednesday after April 13 according to the Julian calendar, approximately April 14-20 in the Gregorian calendar.
useCases: Find Sere Sal date for any year
Plan Yazidi New Year celebrations
Know upcoming celebration dates
Learn about Yazidi calendar and culture
Coordinate with Yazidi friends for occasions
seoTips: Enter the Gregorian year to get the date
Learn about the meaning of Red Wednesday
Use the calculator for advance planning
commonMistakes: Confusing Gregorian and Julian calendars
Assuming Sere Sal falls on the same date each year
Not understanding that the date is always tied to Wednesday

faqs.question: What does Sere Sal mean?
faqs.answer: Sere Sal means 'Head of the Year' in Kurdish, also known as Charshema Sor or Red Wednesday. It is the most important holiday in the Yazidi religion.

faqs.question: Why is it called Red Wednesday?
faqs.answer: The color red is associated with spring, renewal, and life. Yazidis decorate their homes with red flowers and colored eggs to celebrate this day.

faqs.question: How is Sere Sal celebrated?
faqs.answer: It is celebrated by visiting holy sites especially Lalish, coloring eggs, preparing traditional foods, lighting lamps, and wearing new clothes.

yazidi-new-year.tooltip_year: Enter the year to find Sere Sal date
yazidi-new-year.empty_state: Enter a year to find Yazidi New Year dates
yazidi-new-year.footer_note: Sere Sal (Charshema Sor - Red Wednesday) is the Yazidi New Year, falling on the first Wednesday after April 13 (Julian calendar).
yazidi-new-year.info_meaning: Sere Sal means 'Head of the Year' in Kurdish
yazidi-new-year.info_date_calc: Falls on the first Wednesday after April 13 (Julian calendar)
yazidi-new-year.info_traditions: Celebrated with colored eggs, special foods, and visiting holy sites

bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.title: Bar/Bat Mitzvah Calculator
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.description: Calculate Bar/Bat Mitzvah date based on birth date and gender. Free online tool for Jewish lifecycle events.
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.birth_date_tooltip: Enter the birth date in Gregorian calendar
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.gender_tooltip: Select gender - Bar Mitzvah at 13 (male) or Bat Mitzvah at 12 (female)
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.ceremony_age_male: Bar Mitzvah is celebrated when a Jewish boy reaches 13 years of age according to the Hebrew calendar. This marks his coming of age and acceptance of religious responsibilities.
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.ceremony_age_female: Bat Mitzvah is celebrated when a Jewish girl reaches 12 years of age according to the Hebrew calendar. This marks her coming of age and acceptance of religious responsibilities.
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.celebration_saturday: The ceremony typically takes place on the first Shabbat (Saturday) after the Hebrew birthday, when the young person is called to read from the Torah.
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.celebration_traditions: Traditional celebrations include reading from the Torah, leading parts of the prayer service, and a festive gathering with family and community.
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.celebration_info_description: Bar Mitzvah (for boys) and Bat Mitzvah (for girls) are significant Jewish lifecycle events marking the coming of age. Bar Mitzvah occurs at 13 years old, while Bat Mitzvah occurs at 12 years old according to the Hebrew calendar. These ceremonies signify that a young person is now responsible for following Jewish commandments and traditions.
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.tradition_1: Reading from the Torah (Aliyah) - The Bar/Bat Mitzvah is called up to read from the Torah during the synagogue service
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.tradition_2: Haftarah reading - Chanting a portion from the Prophets that relates to the weekly Torah reading
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.tradition_3: D'var Torah - Delivering a speech sharing insights and personal reflections on the Torah portion
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.tradition_4: Celebration feast (Seudat Mitzvah) - A festive meal with family, friends, and community members to mark this important milestone
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.planning_description: Planning for a Bar/Bat Mitzvah typically begins 12-18 months in advance. Important considerations include coordinating with your synagogue for the ceremony date, booking a venue for the celebration, arranging catering, sending invitations, and preparing for the Torah reading and speech. It's essential to work closely with your rabbi and synagogue to ensure all religious requirements are met.
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.error_invalid_date: Please enter a valid birth date
bar_bat_mitzvah_calculator.error_calculation: An error occurred while calculating the Bar/Bat Mitzvah date. Please try again.
